alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Lee; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 4:30PM CDT until April 13 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR EASTERN LEE...EASTERN ST. FRANCIS...CENTRAL CRITTENDEN... DESOTO...NORTHERN TUNICA...NORTHWESTERN TATE AND SOUTHWESTERN SHELBY COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from West Memphis to near Eudora to near North Tunica, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Hernando, Marion, Hughes, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Coldwater, Walls, Tunica, Edmondson, Horseshoe Lake, Anthonyville, Jennette, Lake Cormorant, Southwest Memphis, Simsboro and Brickeys. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and western Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
